conclusion: Consider power, collision, and deflection effects to determine which blocks A will collide with and where it will stop.
Power is determined by mass and velocity; A is a toy car with small mass compared to blocks.
A has low power compared to the blocks.
Collision force is determined by mass and velocity; A is moving towards stationary blocks.
A will collide with the blocks.
Deflection is determined by force exerted by another object; A collides with blocks.
The force exerted by A is not enough to deflect the blocks significantly.
The blocks will stop in their current position.
A will collide with the blocks on the right side of the image and stop when it reaches the group of blocks.
